caption.p: Urtica dioica in the control treatments (a) and impact intensity of Impatiens glandulifera planting and removal (b). With linear models, it was tested whether the shown parameters differed between control plots invaded and uninvaded by I. glandulifera ( p‐values given). Study site was used as random factor (lmer) unless its variance was estimated zero, thus no random factor was used (lm). Impact intensity of I. glandulifera manipulation on each parameter is expressed by relative interaction index (RII) among manipulation and appropriate control per pair of plots. RII of −1 shows most negative impact, 0 no impact, and + 1 most positive impact. For planting and removal separately, it was tested with a one‐sample Wilcoxon test whether RII differs from zero (result indicated by asterisks). Sample sizes are given at the bottom of the graphs. Only pairs of plots are considered in which U. dioica occurred in both plots. Stem length, vegetative, and infructescence biomass of U. dioica represent mean values of 6–8 plants per plot
